definition: to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: We frightened two birds when we were walking in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 我們在樹林裏散步時驚起了兩隻鳥。

sentences.english: Start tup but look back, have no hate.
sentences.chinese: 驚起卻回頭，有恨無人省。

sentences.english: The dog flushed a pheasant from the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗於雉從灌木叢中驚起。

sentences.english: The hunters beat the brush for game.
sentences.chinese: 獵人拍打樹叢以驚起獵物。

sentences.english: I am started at the loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 我被那響亮的吵鬧聲驚起。

sentences.english: In the morning, when the birds are roused by the stir of milking the cows, I will waken you.
sentences.chinese: 明日清晨，鳥雀被擠奶姑娘驚起時我會將你喚醒。

sentences.english: A duck flies off in alarm as an osprey swoops in to catch its lunch.
sentences.chinese: 魚鷹猛撲到池塘抓魚作午餐的時候驚起了一隻鴨子。

sentences.english: When we are walking in the toest , few birds are disturbed.
sentences.chinese: 咱們在樹林裏散步時驚起了兩隻鳥。

sentences.english: Two birds were roused when we had a walk in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 我們在樹林裏散步時驚起了兩隻鳥。

sentences.english: The noise jumped me out of my chair.
sentences.chinese: 這噪聲把我從椅子上驚起。

sentences.english: I started up from my day-dreams and poured water from my jar on thy joined palms.
sentences.chinese: 我從幻夢中驚起把我罐裏的水倒在你掬着的手掌裏。
將幾隻大黃蜂驀地驚起。

sentences.english: I scream at them, and they don't flinch.
sentences.chinese: 我向他們尖聲喊叫，但他們並沒驚起。

sentences.english: Thee dog roused a deer from the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 狗驚起了叢林中的一隻鹿。

sentences.english: The hunting dog put up some partridges.
